profile.name: Nuno Moço
profile.title: Senior Fullstack Developer
profile.summary: I’m a seasoned software engineer with over 15 years of experience, primarily in Web Development and User Experience (UX). I hold a master’s degree in Electronic and Computer Engineering, but my true passion lies in software development. Right now, I’m particularly interested in working with Elixir and Phoenix LiveView.

work.summary: Co-founded a small Startup to develop a recruiting platform with a strong focus on people and fair processes. The platform is skill based first, backed by personality and culture tests to match candidates with the right jobs. The platform was developed from the ground up with Elixir, Phoenix LiveView and PostgreSQL. Custom made CSS library and Phoenix Components.

While at Innogy I worked for npower RWE as Senior Full-stack Developer. I maintained SAPUI5 and NodeJS applications. I was part of the CRM team, which was leading the initiative to re-write internal applications.
Front-end development and UX consulting with SAPUI5, Javascript, VueJS, CSS, and OData.
Front-end development and UX consulting with SAPUI5, Javascript, VueJS, CSS, and OData.
highlights: Won a best consultant award in 2015.

work.summary: Freelancing / contracting projects in web development, frontend and backend. UX, Javascript, NodeJS, ReactJS, VueJS, Python, Elixir, Django, Phoenix, CSS, SQL, etc.

awards.title: SAP Portugal 2015 Q1 Champion
awards.summary: SAP Portugal - Employees Recognition Program Q1 2015. Recognition by the local Management Team as one of Portugal 2015 champions.

publications.name: Smartphone-Based Palmprint Recognition System
publications.summary: The increasing popularity of mobile devices, such as smartphones, has changed the way people access and manage data. In particular, with the increased capabilities of mobile phones, many services are now available and routinely used on the go (e.g., home banking, e-commerce, remote work, internet access and entertainment). As a result, more and more confidential data is now stored on these devices, which significantly increases the risk of information or identity theft by non-authorized access to the mobile device. In this paper, a native biometric recognition system for the Android platform is proposed, offering an additional layer of security when accessing mobile services or important data. The proposed biometric system is based on palmprint features using the Orthogonal Line Ordinal Features (OLOF) extraction technique, achieving promising results in terms of recognition accuracy and speed for a mobile device

projects.name: Compass Group (Freelance)
projects.description: Front-end development in ReactJS. Services in OData with SAP Hana backend. Custom implementation of a meals planner application in ReactJS backed by a SAP backend REST service. Freelancing / Contracting on Site in London.
